brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators aim to determine the complications and risk factors related with
      peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) and central venous catheters (CVCs) in
      cancer patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Complications and Risk Factors Related With Central Venous Catheters in Cancer Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the complications and risk factors related with
      peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) and central venous catheters (CVCs) in
      cancer patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all adult cancer patients with central venous catheters (CVCs) or peripherally
             inserted central catheters (PICCs) placed at BeijingHCH.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  without written informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
All adult cancer patients with CVC and PICC placed at BeijingHCH and with written consent
        for this study

clinical_study.official_title: Complications and Risk Factors Related With Central Venous Catheters in Cancer Patients(CVCCP)

primary_outcome.description: Catheter-related venous thrombosis and catheter-related infections
primary_outcome.measure: Catheter-related venous thrombosis and catheter-related infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after PICC and CVC line withdrawn

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed before PICC and CVC line withdrawn

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
